cons: court process takes a long time
you’re not in control - a judge will make the decision
can be more stressful for your children
increased chance of conflict between you and the other parent
heading: Going to court
information: The court process is different in [Scotland](https://www.mygov.scot/crime-justice-and-the-law/courts-and-sentencing/) and [Northern Ireland](https://www.nidirect.gov.uk/articles/solicitors-and-courts).
lede: You’ll need to go to court if you’ve tried other suitable options and still can’t agree arrangements, or you’re worried about the safety of you or your children.
usp: You want a court to make a decision for you or you have concerns about domestic abuse or child neglect.
